articles.title: DPRK Order Awarded to Russian Ambassador
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Russian Ambassador 
   Pyongyang, December 13 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a talk with Russian Ambassador to the DPRK Andrei Karlov who paid a farewell visit to him at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Wednesday.
 Present there were Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs Kung Sok Ung and Alexander Matsegora, minister-councilor of the Russian embassy here.

DPRK Order Awarded to Russian Ambassador 
   Pyongyang, December 13 (KCNA) -- An order of the DPRK was awarded to Andrei Karlov, Russian ambassador e.p. to the DPRK, at a ceremony held at the Mansudae Assembly Hall today.
 After a decree of the Presidium of the SPA of the DPRK was read out by Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, the Friendship Order First Class of the DPRK was conferred to Andrei Karlov in recognition of his positive contribution made to boosting the bilateral ties of friendship and cooperation.    
 Present there were Kung Sok Ung, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, and officials concerned and Alexandra Matsegora, minister-councilor of the Russian embassy here, and its staff members.

Korean Student Proves Successful at International Concours
   Pyongyang, December 13 (KCNA) -- Ri Myong Gum, DPRK girl studying at Santa Chechilia Conservatory in Rome, won a prize at an international concours for Giacomo Lauri Volpi Prize held in Latina, Italy, from Nov. 30 to Dec. 3. 
 The concours drew 80 renowned male and female singers from the DPRK, Italy, Russia, China and other countries and regions.    
 Ri competed in the adult group that comprised 47 famous professional singers and came second to receive a prize and a diploma.
